title: How to Obtain a Handyman License

steps.headline: Check the licensing requirements in your state.
steps.description: The State Board of Contractors, or a similar agency, will be able to provide you with information on what is required. Look for your state's contact information through the National Contractor License Service: http://www.clsi.com/state_contractor_license_board.htm

steps.headline: Find a professional handyman association in your area.
steps.description: They can also be a great resource in explaining what type of license is required in your state.

steps.headline: Find out from your State Board of Contractors whether you will need a single handyman license, or several.
steps.description: This will depend on your state and the type of services you offer. As an example, a handyman in Arizona must apply for a license in each specific area he services.

steps.headline: Get adequate handyman training.
steps.description: In order to become licensed, you will need to demonstrate credentials in areas of handyman work. Look for classes offered at your local trade school or community college. There are often handyman training programs on the schedule. Find out if training is offered by your state or local handyman association. This might include hands-on training with a qualified and licensed professional as well as classroom learning.

steps.headline: Sign up to take an exam.
steps.description: Most states that require a handyman contractor's license will require you to take and pass an exam. Get testing dates and locations from the State Board of Contractors, and leave yourself enough time to study and prepare before taking the exam.

steps.headline: Study for the exam.
steps.description: There are seminars available through professional handyman associations and the National Contractor License Service. Study code books for your state and any other recommended reading provided by the State Board of Contractors or the National Contractor License Service.

steps.headline: Fill out an application for your license.
steps.description: Once you successfully pass the handyman contractor's exam, you can apply for your license. Test scores are valid for 1 year in most states, so get your license right after you pass your test. Complete any necessary paperwork and forms that are required by your State Board of Contractors. You may be required to submit other documentation, including a resume and proof of insurance, and most states assess a fee for your license.

steps.headline: Create a business name.
steps.description: For states that require a business license, you will need a name for your handyman business.

steps.headline: Get a licensing information packet from your State Board of Contractors.
steps.description: They will provide information on how to register your business name with your state.

steps.headline: Contact your state's office of small business affairs or the Secretary of State for necessary business license application forms.
Submit all of the application paperwork and supporting documentation.
steps.description: Pay any associated fees. Some states will award your business license immediately, and other states will have a 4 to 6 week waiting period.

steps.headline: Establish yourself as a Sole Proprietorship or a Limited Liability Company (LLC).
Obtain liability insurance.
steps.description: Most states require that you are insured, and the amounts of insurance you carry will vary by state. Shop around for the best handyman insurance rates. You can compare quotes on sites such as www.comparethemarket.com and other commercial insurance sites.
